Description: Marl pottery vase with conical body, rounded base, high shoulder, slight inset neck and everted rim. Coated with thick red slip, not polished.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kom el-Ahmar, Fort Cemetery Grave 79 (Hierakonpolis)
Curator's comments: Most like Polished Red ware P92a in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery Grave 79 in the Fort Cemetery was excavated by John Garstang and is published in B. Adams, The Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis (1987), p. 81, where this pot is identified as ?P93a.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Frederick George Hilton Price
